intro: Rubus gentilianus, commonly known as the meadow raspberry, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its prickly stems and clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically red or black in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
